Category:
Report metadata
This should include all metadata related to the test itself, points that are of responsibility of the laboratory. 
This metadata gives the report context.
Parameter description: Information about laboratory that carried out test

Category:
This is the sample metadata. There may be different types of sample metadata such as:
- Measured properties (e.g. moisture content, mass)
- Reported properties (e.g. ore type, lithology, location)
Note that for "Reported properties", a lab will only report back what they have received from a mining company.

Parameter description: coordinates (xyz), drill hole ID, sampling interval
Geomet unit / Ore Type / Mineral group
Mass of head sample input to test
Grades of head sample (e.g., %Cu, g/t Au)

Category:
The test will have Parameters recorded when it is run. Parameters are the controlled input variables key to the test procedure that give context and meaning to the test results. The Parameters of interest will vary based on the type of test. 
May be defined (e.g. target pH) or observed (measured pH).

Parameter description: Grinding method (ball mill, rod mill, wet milling, etc.)
type of gas used for airflow

Category:
For each stage, Parameters (controlled input variables) may be recorded, such as the observed/measured conditions or the reagents added.
There may be a single record for Stage Parameters, or there may be a series of records (where data is recorded on a time interval or during/after cycles).

Measured/Observed/Controlled outcomes from a test stage. There may be a single record for Stage Outputs, or there may be a series of records (where data is recorded on a time interval or during/after cycles).

Test | Outputs
Measured/Observed/Controlled outcomes from a test.
Key results or findings for the overall test
